headline: Amazon Is Now America’s Biggest Company. Its 17-Year Journey to Surpass Walmart.
summary: For nearly two decades,  Walmart  has been the country’s largest company by revenue, a status it touted to prospective hires, employees and suppliers.  On Thursday, Walmart lost its crown.  Amazon.com  —a 31-year-old company—surpassed 63-year-old Walmart as the country’s largest company by annual revenue.

content.title: Amazon Is Now America’s Biggest Company. Its 17-Year Journey to Surpass Walmart.
content.summary: For nearly two decades,  Walmart  has been the country’s largest company by revenue, a status it touted to prospective hires, employees and suppliers.  On Thursday, Walmart lost its crown.  Amazon.com  —a 31-year-old company—surpassed 63-year-old Walmart as the country’s largest company by annual revenue.

headline: Amazon Overtakes Walmart as Biggest U.S. Company
summary: On Thursday, Walmart lost its crown.  Amazon surpassed the 63-year-old retailer as the U.S.'s largest company by annual revenue.  Walmart had $713.2 billion in sales in the year through Jan. 31, compared with Amazon’s $716.9 billion for its most recent full year.

content.title: Amazon Overtakes Walmart as Biggest U.S. Company
content.summary: On Thursday, Walmart lost its crown.  Amazon surpassed the 63-year-old retailer as the U.S.'s largest company by annual revenue.  Walmart had $713.2 billion in sales in the year through Jan. 31, compared with Amazon’s $716.9 billion for its most recent full year.

headline: WMT Q4 Deep Dive: Digital Momentum and Omnichannel Investments Shape Outlook
summary: Retail behemoth Walmart (NYSE:WMT) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 5.6% year on year to $190.7 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $172.2 billion was less impressive, coming in 1.3% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.74 per share was 1.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: WMT Q4 Deep Dive: Digital Momentum and Omnichannel Investments Shape Outlook
content.summary: Retail behemoth Walmart (NYSE:WMT) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 5.6% year on year to $190.7 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $172.2 billion was less impressive, coming in 1.3% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.74 per share was 1.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Walmart's growth requires innovation: 'The world keeps on evolving'
summary: Walmart (WMT) delivered its fourth quarter earnings results on Thursday morning, its first quarterly report under new CEO John Furner. The retailer narrowly beat analyst estimates and issued a cautious full-year outlook. TD Cowen senior research analyst Oliver Chen chats with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss Walmart's growth drivers this year and beyond, emphasizing what Furner should be leaning into. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Walmart's growth requires innovation: 'The world keeps on evolving'
content.description:
Walmart (WMT) delivered its fourth quarter earnings results on Thursday morning, its first quarterly report under new CEO John Furner. The retailer narrowly beat analyst estimates and issued a cautious full-year outlook.

TD Cowen senior research analyst Oliver Chen chats with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss Walmart's growth drivers this year and beyond, emphasizing what Furner should be leaning into.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
content.summary: Walmart (WMT) delivered its fourth quarter earnings results on Thursday morning, its first quarterly report under new CEO John Furner. The retailer narrowly beat analyst estimates and issued a cautious full-year outlook. TD Cowen senior research analyst Oliver Chen chats with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss Walmart's growth drivers this year and beyond, emphasizing what Furner should be leaning into. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Delta Galil posts record sales and margins in FY25, net income slips
summary: Israeli textile firm Delta Galil Industries has concluded fiscal year 2025 (FY25) with record sales and improved gross margins, even as operating and net profits saw a modest decline compared to the previous year.

content.title: Delta Galil posts record sales and margins in FY25, net income slips
content.summary: Israeli textile firm Delta Galil Industries has concluded fiscal year 2025 (FY25) with record sales and improved gross margins, even as operating and net profits saw a modest decline compared to the previous year.

headline: A Blue Note on Private Credit: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap
summary: Blue Owl Capital set off a wave of selling in asset managers.  The private credit firm restricted withdrawals from a fund aimed at ordinary investors.  This added to concerns around the lack of transparency in private investments and whether they are suitable for everyday investors.

content.title: A Blue Note on Private Credit: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap
content.summary: Blue Owl Capital set off a wave of selling in asset managers.  The private credit firm restricted withdrawals from a fund aimed at ordinary investors.  This added to concerns around the lack of transparency in private investments and whether they are suitable for everyday investors.
